title: Spectral theory of the Nazarov-Sklyanin Lax operator. (arXiv:2211.01586v1 [math.CO])
description: In their study of Jack polynomials, Nazarov-Sklyanin introduced a remarkable new graded linear operator $\mathcal{L}: F[w] \rightarrow F[w]$ where $F$ is the ring of symmetric functions. In this paper, we (1) establish a cyclic decomposition $F[w] \cong \bigoplus_{\lambda} Z(j_{\lambda}, \mathcal{L})$ of the domain of $\mathcal{L}$ into finite-dimensional $\mathcal{L}$-cyclic subspaces in which Jack polynomials $j_{\lambda}$ may be taken as cyclic vectors and (2) prove that the restriction of $\mathcal{L}$ to each $Z(j_{\lambda}, \mathcal{L})$ has simple spectrum given by the anisotropic contents $[s]$ of the addable corners $s$ of the Young diagram of $\lambda$. Our proofs of (1) and (2) rely on the commutativity and spectral theorem for the integrable hierarchy of $\mathcal{L}$, both established by Nazarov-Sklyanin. Finally, we derive and conjecture several properties of the $\mathcal{L}$-eigenfunctions $\psi_{\lambda}^s$ which satisfy $\psi_{\lambda}^s|_{w=0} = j_{\lambda}$.
